summary: This document appears to be a summary of prepared testimony for trial, likely from a witness (referred to as 'E' or '3515-007') regarding their interactions with Jeffrey Epstein. It details phone calls with Epstein, discussions about a trip to New Mexico for students, and Epstein's financial support and stated interest in helping students.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE'. The witness estimates speaking with him 6 or more times on the phone, understood he was the boss, and discusses his offers to pay for student trips and open doors for opportunities.

connections.description: Epstein called E multiple times, presented himself as wanting to help/open doors for E, and offered to pay for all expenses for E and other students on a trip to New Mexico.

events.title: Phone calls from Jeffrey Epstein to witness
events.description: The witness estimates speaking with Jeffrey Epstein 6 or more times on the phone. During the first call, the witness was running a vacuum cleaner. Epstein expressed being impressed and wanting to help open doors and provide opportunities.

events.title: Planning for student trip to New Mexico
events.description: Epstein discussed a trip for students to New Mexico, stating they would stay in cabins. He told the witness he would be paying for all expenses for all the students. The trip was framed as an opportunity to join other students traveling abroad.

keyFacts: A witness prepared for trial testimony estimated speaking with Jeffrey Epstein six or more times on the phone.
Jeffrey Epstein told the witness he was impressed with them and wanted to 'help open doors' and provide opportunities similar to those he provided for other students.
Epstein discussed funding a trip for students to New Mexico, offering to pay for all expenses, with students staying in cabins.
The document indicates the witness's recollections are not exact on some dates and that they have 'had a lot going on in the past few years'.
